attributes.action: Support Public Houses do not introduce The Vertical Drinking Legislation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Local Councils and indeed some MPs are setting the agenda so that Licensed premises will not be able to serve drinks to any persons standing up at the bar and ordering a drink, either in a glass or a bottle.Quite simply you will have to order and then return to a seat within the premises.More and more Local Councils are looking into introducing a blanket ban on our ability to be able to order a drink at the bar and stand up whilst drinking. This needs to be challenged by everybody who supports the tradition of The Great British Public House. Our Landlords need more support than ever to be able to continue to trade and the working man and woman needs to be able to make their own decision as to whether they sit down or not to drink. Responsibility for a safe drinking environment is the responsibility of each Licensed premises, we do not want a blanket ban, let the Police oppose applications for a License on those premises which serve without control and leave our local Public Houses alone.

Mark Dilworth
